thread.title: Poll: Congress, Boehner receive poor marks
thread.title_full: Poll: Congress, Boehner receive poor marks - CBS News

author: CBS News
title: Poll: Congress, Boehner receive poor marks
text:
By Anthony Salvanto, Jennifer De Pinto, Sarah Dutton and Fred Backus 
Congress Speaker of the House of Representatives John Boehner announced he will be leaving Congress at the end of this month. In this poll, 23 percent approve of the job he is doing as Speaker, while more -- 52 percent -- disapprove, and 24 percent don't have an opinion.
The Republican Speaker receives poor marks from members of his own party. Just 23 percent of Republicans approve of the job he is doing as Speaker. Approval falls to 19 percent among conservative Republicans; 66 percent of them disapprove. Among those who describe themselves as supporters of the tea party, 22 percent approve.
Boehner's Job Approval Rating 
All Reps Dems Inds Tea 
Party Conservative
Reps Approve 23% 23% 29% 19% 22% 19% Disapprove 52 58 51 50 62 66 Don't know 24 19 20 31 16 15 Americans continue to give Congress decidedly poor marks. Only 12 percent of Americans approve of the job Congress is doing, while 79 percent disapprove.
The parties Views of both parties are more negative than positive - but that has been true for some time. Americans are slightly more apt to view the Democratic Party favorably.
Democrats are more likely to see their own party in a positive light than Republicans are to say the same about their party.
Views of the Parties 
Republican Party 
among Republicans Democratic Party
among Democrats Favorable 64% 87% Not favorable 31 9 President Obama As has been the case since early this year, President Obama's overall job approval rating remains mixed: Forty-five percent of Americans approve of the job he is doing as President and 46 percent disapprove. The president's approval rating has been largely unchanged since January.
As has been the case since early this year, President Obama's overall job approval rating remains mixed: Forty-five percent of Americans approve of the job he is doing as President and 46 percent disapprove. The president's approval rating has been largely unchanged since January.
And while views of the president's handling of the economy are also mixed, negative assessments outweigh positive views on his handling of foreign policy. On that issue, just 36 percent approve and 53 percent disapprove. In May, evaluations were similar.
The economy, direction of the country Views on the condition of the economy have changed little since the summer. Now, 46 percent of Americans think the economy is at least fairly good, while slightly more -- 53 percent -- say it is bad. 
By more than two to one, Americans see the country as headed in the wrong track. A majority of Americans has said the country is on the wrong track for years now.
